intro: Oxystelma senegalense, commonly known as the Senegalese oxystelma, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy yellow or orange flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Oxystelma senegalense is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
